parameters.content: ## Step 1. Save news in a vector store (runs daily)

categories.description: AI and Artificial Intelligence related articles

parameters.content:
## Step 2: Relevance scoring

Consider improving this by using
- [serp api](https://serpapi.com/dashboard)
- [jina ai](https://jina.ai/api-dashboard/reader)
- [perplexity ai](https://www.perplexity.ai/)
- [open ai web search](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eeuLRpvQ3DY)

parameters.text:
=Here are 24 trending AI-related articles published today:

 {{ JSON.stringify($json.data) }}

From this, generate:
1. 10 unique long-tail blog title ideas based on these trends
2. For each title, suggest:
   - Main keyword
   - Related keywords
   - Suggested angle or tone (e.g. educational, provocative, analytical)
3. Ensure each title is SEO-friendly, non-generic, and future-resilient
4. Always respond in portuguese (pt-br)

options.systemMessage: You are a content strategist for an AI-focused blog.

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
[
  {
  "title": "Why Code Review AI Like CriticGPT Might Replace Juniors",
  "main_keyword": "AI code review",
  "related_keywords": ["CriticGPT", "OpenAI", "developer tools", "LLM code agent"],
  "tone": "analytical",
  "link_articles": ["https://www.hatica.io/blog/future-of-code-reviews-2025-trends/", "https://graphite.dev/blog/ai-wont-replace-human-code-review", "https://medium.com/@ravibiswas0909/can-ai-replace-junior-developers-my-honest-take-861c7d430ce7"],
  "date": "2025-06-16"
},{
  "title": "Huawei AI chips that power BYD and self driving cars in china",
  "main_keyword": "AI chips",
  "related_keywords": ["Huawei", "AI", "self driving cars", "BYD"],
  "tone": "skeptical",
  "link_articles": ["https://technode.com/2025/03/11/chinas-gac-to-sell-level-3-autonomous-driving-vehicles-with-huawei/", "https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/chinas-byd-use-huaweis-advanced-autonomous-driving-system-off-road-evs-2024-08-27/", "https://schen583.medium.com/huawei-intelligent-driving-solutions-overview-a-16-billion-valued-automotive-tier-1-f88f4bdfdff9"],
  "date": "2025-06-16"
}
]

parameters.content:
## Steps 
[Source](https://n8n.io/workflows/5230-content-farming-ai-powered-blog-automation-for-wordpress/)
1. RSS Feed Ingestion (Daily Trigger)
[x] Fetch latest articles from curated AI RSS feeds:
[x] OpenAI, Meta AI, DeepMind, arXiv AI, HuggingFace, TechCrunch AI, VentureBeat AI, etc.
[x] Deduplicate and store links + metadata (title, date, summary)

2. Relevance Filtering
[x] Filter for articles:
[x] Published within last 24 hours
[x] Containing key topics: model releases, tool updates, research, AI regulation, etc.
[x] Score relevance using: Keyword match, Named entity recognition, Popularity heuristics (retweet count, domain authority, etc.)

3. Content Summarization
[x] Summarize 2–3 selected articles using extractive + abstractive methods
Extract:
[x] Key ideas
[x] Notable names (models, companies, researchers)
[x] Quotes or stats

4. Long-Tail Angle Generation
Convert short-tail news into long-tail evergreen angles: E.g. “OpenAI launches CriticGPT” → “Why AI Code Review Will Replace Junior Engineers”
Use prompt chaining:
[x] Step 1: extract the core topic
[x] Step 2: generate 5 long-tail blog titles with intent match (e.g., 'how', 'why', 'what's next')
[x] Step 3: score titles based on uniqueness + search intent

5. SEO-Driven Outline Creation
Generate outline optimized for:
[x] H1 + H2 structure
[x] Natural keyword inclusion
[x] Featured snippet targeting
[x] Structure: Intro → Background → Trend → Insight → Forecast → CTA

6. Full-Length Blog Drafting
[x] Draft 1,000–1,500 word blog using outline
Include:
[x] Citations from original articles
[x] External links for trust
[x] Analogies, examples, future implications
[x] Maintain tone: informative, thought-leader, semi-technical

7. SEO Enrichment
Generate:
[x] Meta title (60 chars)
[x] Meta description (160 chars)
[x] Alt text for images
[x] Slug URL with keyword
[x] Auto-check for keyword density, passive voice, Flesch score

8. Image Generation (Optional)
[x] Create featured image using AI (e.g., DALL·E)

9. Export & Publish
[x] Export article in Markdown or HTML
[x] Push to CMS (e.g., WordPress REST API)
[x] publish immediately
[ ] schedule

10. Logging & Feedback Loop
[x] Log:
- Source articles
- Generated title
- Keywords used
- Post URL
- Store in database for:
- Deduplication
- Trend tracking
- Traffic correlation
[ ] Feedback loop:

## Step 3: Research the news articles
**Double click** to edit me. [Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/sticky-notes/)

parameters.text:
=Below is an article. Extract the 3 most important sentences that summarize the factual content. Do not interpret. Only copy exact sentences.

Use that to extract and list:
1. write a 2-paragraph summary of the article in your own words.
2. Key concepts or ideas
3. Names of companies, models, or researchers
4. Any quoted statements or numerical/statistical claims
5. Always respond in portuguese (pt-br)

Here is the article:
 {{ $json.data }}

=You are a viral blog strategist. Given the following blog article concept: {{ JSON.stringify($json) }}

Important: Always respond in portuguese (pt-br)

Generate 5 compelling blog post titles that:
- Evoke curiosity or urgency
- Include emotional or controversial angles
- Use long-tail keywords for SEO
- Are clear, specific, and make the reader want to click
- Follow formats like:
  - “Why [X] Is About to Change Everything in [Y]”
  - “The Hidden Truth About [Topic]”
  - “How [Persona] Are Using [X] to [Y]”
  - “What No One Tells You About [Topic]”
  - “X Predictions About the Future of [Topic] That’ll Shock You”

End your response with:  
**Core Topic:** [a single phrase summarizing the article idea]

parameters.content:
## Step 4,5,6,7: Write the article and prepare SEO
**Double click** to edit me. [Guide](https://docs.n8n.io/workflows/sticky-notes/)

parameters.text:
=Rate the following blog titles based on the **core topic**. Score each title out of 10 in:
1. Uniqueness
2. SEO keyword clarity
3. Emotional and curiosity-driven clickbait quality

Titles: {{ JSON.stringify($json.output.titles) }}
Core Topic: {{ JSON.stringify($json.output.core_topic) }}

Return a ranked list with justifications for each score. Highlight the best one.
Important: Always respond in portuguese (pt-br)

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
[
  {
    "title": "Why AI Code Review Will Replace Junior Engineers",
    "uniqueness_score": 8,
    "seo_score": 7,
    "longtail_score": 9,
    "reason": "Strong intent signal ('why'), specific audience reference ('junior engineers'), but replacement framing may be oversimplified."
  },
  {
    "title": "How AI is Reshaping Software QA in 2025",
    "uniqueness_score": 6,
    "seo_score": 9,
    "longtail_score": 8,
    "reason": "Good long-tail and temporal relevance, but the 'reshaping' verb is generic and the angle lacks a unique hook."
  },
  {
    "title": "What CriticGPT Means for Developer Workflows",
    "uniqueness_score": 5,
    "seo_score": 6,
    "longtail_score": 6,
    "reason": "Moderately informative but lacks specificity, and may be too short-tail. Could benefit from clearer impact framing."
  },
  {
    "title": "The Future of Code Reviews: AI vs Human Engineers",
    "uniqueness_score": 7,
    "seo_score": 8,
    "longtail_score": 9,
    "reason": "Decent contrast-based framing. 'Future of' titles have strong SEO pull, but risk becoming overused."
  },
  {
    "title": "5 Benefits of Using AI for Code Quality Control",
    "uniqueness_score": 6,
    "seo_score": 10,
    "longtail_score": 8,
    "reason": "Clear list format, strong SEO structure, but uses a very common benefits-based formula with a broad target."
  }
]

parameters.text:
=You are an SEO blog strategist.

Given:
- Title: {{ $('Update documents1').item.json.blog_title }}
- Main keyword: {{ $('Find documents1').item.json.main_keyword }}
- Related keywords: {{ JSON.stringify($('Find documents1').item.json.related_keywords) }}
- Related articles: {{ JSON.stringify($('Find documents1').item.json.articles) }}

Generate a detailed outline for a blog post that:
- Uses a strong **H1** as the main title
- Includes **H2 subheadings** for each major section
- Naturally incorporates the main keyword and related keywords
- Follows this structure:
  1. Intro
  2. Background
  3. Trend
  4. Insight
  5. Forecast
  6. CTA
- Is optimized for **featured snippet** inclusion on Google

Important: Always respond in portuguese (pt-br)

Respond in Markdown format. Include H1 and H2 tags.

parameters.text:
=Based on the blog article below, generate:
1. A **meta title** (max 60 characters)
2. A **meta description** (max 160 characters)
3. An **image alt text** for the featured image
4. A **URL slug** based on the blog title and keyword
5. A basic SEO report:
   - Keyword density for the main keyword
   - Count of passive voice sentences
   - Estimated Flesch reading score (0–100 scale)
6. Important: Always respond in portuguese (pt-br)

Data:
- Title:  {{ $('Update documents1').item.json.blog_title }}
- Main Keyword: {{ $('Find documents1').item.json.main_keyword }}
- Related Keywords: {{ JSON.stringify($('Find documents1').item.json.related_keywords) }}
- Content: {{ $('Update documents5').item.json.blog_article }}

options.systemMessage: You are a creative visual expert in marketing and digital design. Your job is to craft emotionally compelling image prompts that generate click bait images for social media posts

parameters.content: ## Step 8,9: Generate image and create blog article

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
[
  {
    "outline": "```markdown
# Navigating Legal Complexities in AI and Copyright: A Complete Guide

## Introduction: The Intersection of AI and Copyright
The rise of generative AI has sparked a seismic shift in the creative landscape, leading to a plethora of AI copyright issues that challenge traditional views on intellectual property. As artists, musicians, and creators increasingly turn to AI-generated content, the question arises: who owns the rights to these creations? In this guide, we will explore the nuances of AI copyright issues, the implications for creativity rights, and what the future holds for artists harnessing the power of AI.

## Background: Understanding AI and Copyright
In order to grasp the complexities of AI copyright issues, one must first understand the fundamentals of copyright law and its application to generative AI. Copyright is designed to protect original works of authorship, but the emergence of AI-generated content complicates this traditional framework. This section will cover:
- Key definitions of intellectual property.
- The role of creativity rights in copyright law.
- Examples of how traditional copyright has been challenged by advancements in generative AI technologies.

## Trend: The Rise of Generative AI and Its Impact
The increasing sophistication of generative AI tools means more creators are using these technologies to produce art and music. This trend raises significant questions about originality and ownership. In this section, we will discuss:
- Notable applications of generative AI in various creative fields.
- The ongoing debate surrounding the legality and ethics of AI-generated content.
- Highlighting perspectives from industry experts, including insights from creators like Ed Sheeran on the nature of creativity in a world shaped by AI.

## Insight: The Tension Between Innovation and Copyright Law
As the lines blur between human creativity and machine-generated art, there is a growing tension between innovation and the protection of creativity rights. This section will delve into:
- Case studies showcasing the struggles artists face in asserting ownership over AI-assisted works.
- Quotations from thought leaders, such as Ed Sheeran’s view on the shared building blocks of creativity.
- Analyzing the statements of influential figures who have commented on the implications of AI on artistic expression, including references to past artistic movements.

## Forecast: The Future of AI Copyright Issues
Looking ahead, the legal frameworks surrounding AI copyright issues are likely to evolve. This section will provide:
- Predictions on how copyright law may adapt to accommodate the realities of generative AI.
- Insights into potential policy changes and reforms that could arise from ongoing debates.
- A discussion on the importance of fostering a balanced approach that respects creativity rights while encouraging innovation.

## Call to Action: Join the Conversation
As the landscape of AI-generated content continues to evolve, the need for informed stakeholders is more critical than ever. We encourage readers to engage in this important dialogue. Share your thoughts on AI copyright issues and how you see the future of creativity rights developing. Stay updated with our latest insights and contribute to shaping the future of intellectual property in the age of AI.
```
"
  }
]
